ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.1_0: At one time when the Buddha was staying at Sāvatthī in Anāthapiṇḍika’s Monastery,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.3_0: Then a certain lay follower approached the nun Thullanandā
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.4_0: “Venerable, what’s wrong with you? What may I get you?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.6_0: Then that lay follower gave a _kahāpaṇa_ to the coins and took ghee.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.10_0: That lay follower went to that novice and said,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.13_0: “Sir, if we were to take back goods that have been sold, when would our goods be sold?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.14_0: When ghee is bought, ghee is taken away. Buying oil, you receive that, and you’ll take that away.”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.15_0: Then that lay follower complained and criticized him,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.16_0: “How could Venerable Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.17_0: The nuns heard the complaints of that lay follower.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.18_0: The nuns of few desires complained and criticized her,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.20_0: who in turn told the Buddha. Soon afterwards he had the Sangha gathered and said,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.21_0: “Is it true, monks, that the nun Thullanandā did this?”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.24_0: “... How could the nun Thullanandā ask for one thing and then for something else?
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.25_0: This won’t give rise to confidence in those without it ...”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.26_0: “And, monks, the nuns should recite this training rule like this:
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:1.27.1_0: ‘If a nun asks for one thing and then for something else, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.’”
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.4_0: ...The nun who has been given the full ordination by both Sanghas through a legal procedure consisting of one motion and three announcements that is irreversible and fit to stand—this sort of nun is meant in this case.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.8_0: apart from that thing, if she asks for something else, then for the effort there is an act of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.9_0: When he gets the robe-cloth, it becomes subject to relinquishment.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.10_0: It is to be relinquished to the Sangha of nuns, a group, or an individual nun.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.11_0: “And, monks, it should be relinquished like this. ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.1.13_0: ... ‘Venerables, this thing, which I asked for after asking for something else, is to be relinquished. I relinquish it to the Sangha.’ ...
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.1_0: If it is something else and she perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.2_0: If it is something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.3_0: If it is something else, but she does not perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense entailing relinquishment and confession.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.4_0: If it is not something else, but she perceives it as such, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.5_0: If it is not something else, but she is unsure of it, and she asks for that, she commits an offense of wrong conduct.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.2.6_0: If it is not something else, and she does not perceive it as such, there is no offense.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.1_0: there is no offense for him.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.2_0: If he asks for something else,
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.3_0: if she asks for a benefit and then asks for it;
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.5_0: if she is the first offender.
ai-pli-tv-bi-vb-np4:2.3.6_0: The fourth training rule is finished.
